alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 12:13AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Georgetown and Williamsburg Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1212 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gourdin to near Cape Romain. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Kingstree, Pawleys Island, Yawkey South Island, Murrells Inlet, Winyah Bay Entrance, Andrews, Hemingway, North Santee, Rhems, Cades, Oatland, Nesmith, Indiantown, Sampit, Plantersville, Outland, Earle and Hebron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
